meanings.definition: The trade of selling textiles and haberdashery.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, mercery was a common way for people to buy fabrics and sewing supplies.
meanings.sent2: I visited the mercery to purchase some new threads for my sewing project.
meanings.sent3: The mercery owner joked that he could weave a magical cloak out of all the fabrics in his shop.
meanings.sent4: Her love for mercery was like a colorful tapestry woven into the fabric of her life.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors and soft textures of the fabrics in the mercery enchanted the customers.

meanings.definition: A shop selling textiles and haberdashery.
meanings.sent1: Let's stop by the mercery on our way home to pick up some buttons for my shirt.
meanings.sent2: The mercery on the corner always has a great selection of ribbons and lace.
meanings.sent3: The mercery cat loves to play hide and seek among the bolts of fabric.
meanings.sent4: The mercery stood out in the town like a bright patch of color on a dull canvas.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh fabric greeted me as I entered the mercery, making me feel at home.

meanings.definition: The goods sold by a mercer.
meanings.sent1: The mercery displayed a variety of silks and linens in its windows.
meanings.sent2: I needed to restock my sewing supplies, so I headed to the mercery down the street.
meanings.sent3: The mercery's shelves were overflowing with buttons, threads, and needles.
meanings.sent4: The mercery's treasures sparkled like gems in a treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: As a mercer, he took pride in the quality of the mercery's offerings to his customers.
